intro: Ocotea jacquinii, commonly known as Jacquin's ocotea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and bark. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland and montane forests. Its leaves are dark green,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed.
